properties.name: Peter Blanken
properties.description: Measuring evaporation from the Great Lakes to understand how water levels are affected by evaporation and thus how water levels will change with global warming.

properties.name: Suzanne Anderson, Noah Molotch, Holly Barnard, Theo Barnhart, and Brittany Selander
properties.description: Critical zone science: the interactions of water, weathering, erosion, and organisms that shape Earth's surface.

properties.name: Holly Barnard
properties.description: Understanding how baldcypress forests respond to altered flood regimes in the lower Mississippi valley.

properties.name: Noah Molotch
properties.description: Investigating rain events vs. snow events and downstream flow effects.

properties.name: Tom Veblen
properties.description: Examining the impacts of climate change on tree demography,wildfire activity, bark beetle outbreaks, and forest ecosystem responses to natural and human-caused disturbances on the dynamics of forests in the Colorado Rocky Mountains.

properties.name: Peter Blanken
properties.description: Carbon and water cycling research in Alpine tundra and Subalpine forests.

properties.name: John Pitlick
properties.description: LiDAR-based estimates of sediment transport in volcanic rivers.

properties.name: Carson Farmer
properties.description: Working with a team of researchers and community stakeholders in New York City to model future urban structure scenarios in an effort to examine the resilience of various communities towards projected future climate change. This work is part of a large, multi-institutional NSF grant focused on Urban Resilience to Extreme Events (NSF-UREx).

properties.name: Noah Molotch, Kate Hale
properties.description: Investigating rain events vs. snow events and downstream flow effects.

properties.name: Colleen Reid
properties.description: Investigation of the effects of air pollution from wildfires and respiratory and cardiovascular health.

properties.name: Holly Barnard
properties.Supporting_Grad: Sidney Bush, Andrew Birch, Stephanie Jarvis
properties.description: Investigating the impacts of land-use change on hydrology, forest ecology, and water provisioning to the Panama Canal.

properties.name: Jennifer Balch
properties.description: Studies the role of fire in the Earth system, how fire contributes to global trends of climate warming, and how climate warming promotes fire. She has done intensive work, including long-term experimental burns in Brazil, to study the effects of fire on forests in the Amazon.

properties.name: Joe Bryan
properties.description: Research on indigenous territorial rights and new media in Zapotec communities in the Sierra Juarez.

properties.name: Fernando Riosmena
properties.description: Focuses on the economic, social, policy, and environmental factors explaining why Mexicans migrate out of their communities, both to other destinations within Mexico and, especially, to the United States. Riosmena also does work comparing these drivers across communities, over time, and relative to those of other nations in Latin America.

properties.name: Joe Bryan
properties.description: Research on the role of participatory mapping in advancing legal recognition of land rights for indigenous and black communities, with a focus on the Mayangna community of Awas Tingni.

properties.name: Joe Bryan
properties.description: Participatory mapping with Miskito communities to advance recognition of their territorial rights.

properties.name: Joe Bryan
properties.description: Research on indigenous political mobilization against oil drilling and exploration in the upper Amazon basin.

properties.name: Joe Bryan
properties.description: Research on Mapuche land rights and plantation forestry

properties.name: Tom Veblen
properties.description: Examining the impacts of climate change and land-use practices (such as introduced wild animals and livestock) on wildfire activity and forest ecosystem responses in Patagonian Chile and Argentina.

properties.name: Noah Molotch
properties.description: Snow survey

properties.name: Waleed Abdalati
properties.description: Develops methods for determining how much meltwater is stored in and lost from melt lakes on the surface of the Greenland ice sheet. Studies the nature of near-surface snow on the Greenland ice sheet

properties.name: Mark Serreze
properties.description: Mass balance studies of high Arctic ice caps

properties.name: Suzanne Anderson
properties.description: Studied the hydrologic system of Kennicott Glacier, Alaska

properties.name: Mark Serreze
properties.description: Analyzing  snow cover properties over the Arctic tundra

properties.name: John O'Loughlin
properties.description: Researching the diffusion of violence

properties.description: Investigating relations among ethnic groups in post-war zones of former Soviet Union

properties.description: Studying geopolitical attitudes in the wake of the Crimean annexation

properties.name: John Pitlick
properties.description: Modeling sediment loads of rivers draining the French Alps

properties.name: Emily Yeh
properties.description: Studies the political economy and cultural politics of migration, development, and urbanization in Tibet.

properties.name: Emily Yeh
properties.description: Studies the political ecology of pastoral environment and development policies as well as herders' vulnerability to and knowledge of climate change.

properties.name: Tim Oakes
properties.description: Studying tourism and heritage politics in Guizhou; rapid urbanization and accompanying social changes. Tim is currently studying whether rapid urban change in China is producing the kinds of results envisioned by planners and officials

properties.name: Emily Yeh
properties.description: Studies place-making and transnational migration in Humla.

properties.name: Mark Williams
properties.description: Collaborating with Sherubtse College faculty to analyze hydrochemistry samples that indicate how much river water comes from melting glaciers and snowpack.

properties.name: Emily Yeh
properties.description: Studies Chinese development and investment in other parts of Asia

properties.name: Najeeb Jan
properties.description: Studies political Islam in Pakistan, particularly the Deoband movement.

properties.name: Jennifer Fluri
properties.description: Worked on the use of public and private space by the Revolutionary Association of the Women of Afghanistan, which was based in Pakistan

properties.name: Mara Goldman
properties.description: Community based conservation teaching

properties.name: Jennifer Fluri
properties.description: Worked on how both the local Afghan population and the international community in Kabul seek to provide for their own security in a context of political violence. She also is currently working on the role and influence of Afghan Women's civil society organizations on sustaining peace in Afghanistan.

properties.name: Mara Goldman
properties.description: Studies: community based wildlife conservation- politics of knowledge and participation, changing pastoral rangeland management systems,  knowledge co-production for climate change adaptation, and women's empowerment processes and access to land in Maasai communities.

properties.name: Mara Goldman
properties.description: Community based wildlife conservation in Pastoral rangelands

properties.name: Joel Correia
properties.description: Investigating the territorial rights of indigenous peoples in relation to human rights violations by the Paraguayan government. Research centers on the impacts of multicultural governance for creating greater social equity and the politics of implementing Inter-American Court of Human Rights and Commission decisions regarding four indigenous cases in the Chaco

properties.name: Max Counter
properties.description: Studies dispossession, land restitution, and transitional justice in Colombia.

properties.name: Gabriella Subia Smith
properties.description: Studies participatory mapping and rural communities in Popayan, Colombia.

properties.name: Daniela Marini
properties.description: Studying the paradox of the food sovereignty movement and Bolivian migrant farmworkers producing crops for domestic consumption in Argentina, in a context of rising expansion of industrial agriculture for export

properties.name: Aaron Malone
properties.description: Investigating how  migrants living in the US work together to promote community improvement projects in their hometowns in Mexico? How are these efforts shaped by interactions with the Mexican government and how do they vary across the diverse transnational contexts of Mexico-US migration?

properties.name: Kaitlin Fertaly
properties.description: Studies the political and economic changes affecting women everyday life and domestic labor following the collapse of the Soviet Union

properties.name: Salam Hindawi
properties.description: Push and pull factors for Syrian refugees amid the rise of islamophobic sentiments and islamic terrorism as well as  the integration process of the Syrian refugees

properties.name: Caitln Ryan
properties.description: Studies urban space and identity in traditional Uzbek neighborhoods and new, multistory apartment blocks in Osh, a city on the border of Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan

properties.name: Alice Hill
properties.description: Collaborating with faculty and students from Tajik National University to analyze hydrochemistry samples that indicate how much river water comes from melting glaciers and snowpack

properties.name: Alice Hill and Alana Wilson
properties.description: Collaborating with faculty and students from Tajik National University to analyze hydrochemistry samples that indicate how much river water comes from melting glaciers and snowpack.

properties.name: Alana Wilson
properties.description: Collaborating with Kathmandu University faculty and students to analyze hydrochemistry samples that indicate how much river water comes from melting glaciers and snowpack

properties.name: Galen Murton
properties.description: Studies the geopolitics of road-building, trade, and mobility on the Nepal-Tibet border.

properties.name: Jessica DiCarlo
properties.description: Studying post-earthquake agricultural transition, smallholder and community resilience, and the role of community forest institutions in recovery, and reconstruction

properties.name: Sierra Gladfelter
properties.description: Examining the politics of knowledge that surround flooding in the lower Karnali River basin. She focuses on local struggles to control the design, position and implementation of flood solutions.

properties.name: Siddharth Mennon
properties.description: Studying indigenous architectural practices and knowledge

properties.name: Amy Schubert
properties.description: Studies the effects on sending communities of female out-marriage migration from China Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture to South Korea.

properties.name: Yang Yang
properties.description: Studies how urban space is visualized, represented, and experienced by the Muslim Hui minority in Xi'an

properties.name: Xi Wang
properties.description: Looking at planning for the electric power sector and how various planning agencies and research institutes plan and anticipate changes in energy demands and coordinate growth between electricity generation and transmission

properties.name: Sarah Tynen
properties.description: Studying authoritarian governance and state bureaucratic power in Ugyhur ethnic minority urban neighborhoods in Urumqi, the capital of Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China.

properties.name: Dorje Tashi
properties.description: Studies how housing and other development policies affects Tibetan labor migration to urban areas

properties.name: Ian Rowen
properties.description: Studies the geopolitics of cross-straits tourism between China and Taiwan, as well as political protest in Taiwan and Hong Kong.

properties.name: Shae Frydenlund
properties.description: Studies how anti-Muslim sentiment and gendered aid interventions affect labor and housing for Rohyinga refugees in Myanmar

properties.name: Elizabeth Wharton
properties.description: Studies the Chinese development model in Ethiopia, especially the use of Special Economic Zones

properties.name: Eric Lovell
properties.description: Studies how the making of boundaries affect human and wildlife movements in the Tanzania-Kenya borderlands

properties.name: Meredith DeBoom
properties.description: Studies how Chinese investment has facilitated state-led resource extraction in Namibia.

properties.name: Angela Cunningham
properties.description: Analyzing the movements and characteristics of thousands of American First World War soldiers using linked service and census records to examine how military practices and ideologies affect places and people far beyond the battlefield

properties.name: Tom Veblen
properties.description: Co-leads a large collaborative research project on feedbacks and consequences of altered fire regimes in the face of climate and landuse change in Tasmania,New Zealand and the western U.S.

properties.name: Tom Veblen
properties.description: Co-leads a large collaborative research project on how warming climate is altering fire regimes and vegetation patterns in western Australian shrub lands and western U.S. forests.

properties.name: Tom Veblen
properties.description: Co-leads a large collaborative research project on feedbacks and consequences of altered fire regimes in the face of climate and landuse change in Tasmania,New Zealand and the western U.S.

properties.name: John O'Loughlin
properties.description: Researching the possible link between climate/environmental change and conflict

properties.name: John O'Loughlin
properties.description: Investigating geopolitical attitudes to Russia

properties.name: John Pitlick
properties.description: Studying sediment supply and channel morphology in mountain river systems

properties.name: John Pitlick
properties.description: Studying geomorphic response to base level fall, NE Tibetan Plateau.

properties.name: Mark Serreze
properties.description: Mass balance studies of high Arctic ice caps

properties.name: Suzanne Anderson
properties.description: Rock strength and weathering across a climate gradient

properties.name: Martha Morrissey
properties.description: Investigating the social, economic, natural, and physical factors that impact cycling participation in American cities, to answer the question: Why are some American cities more conducive to cycling than others?

properties.name: Jessica DiCarlo
properties.description: conducted comparative case studies on how information and communication technologies may enhance access to breast and cervical cancer prevention, screenings and diagnosis

properties.name: Rupak Shrestha
properties.description: Rupak examines the ways in which Chinese extra-territorial sovereignty, Nepali state-building practices produce new forms of Tibetan subjectivities in Boudha, Kathmandu. His research investigates how micro-scale interactions and events of place making among Tibetans and members of other ethnic groups (Tamangs) in Boudha reveal the intricacies of macro-scale geopolitics of sovereignty and state-building

properties.name: Kate Hale
properties.description: investigating rain events vs. snow events and downstream flow effects.

properties.name: Erika Schreiber
properties.description: Investigating the effects and influence on of synoptic cyclones on sea ice conditions in the Arctic.

properties.name: Adam Mahood
properties.description: Investigating long term fire effects on plant communities.

properties.name: Joel Correia
properties.description: Investigations about environmental justice, resource politics, and agricultural production with indigenous, campesino, and large-scale producer groups. Research includes studies on soybean production for international commodity markets, the fair trade production of yerba mate as an alternative development strategy, and land rights of different social groups.

properties.name: George Charisoulis
properties.description: Community Solar

properties.name: Shane P Grigsby
properties.description: Algorithm development for the ICESat-1 and ICESat-2 satellites, including roughness detection, surface morphology classification, and slope change detection. A primary focus of our work is assessing the changing state of melt water pathways on the ice sheet--and the impacts that these pathways have on both the current and future evacuation of melt water from the ice sheet and into the oceans

properties.name: Shane P Grigsby
properties.description: Deployed a new CU built photon counting polarization LiDAR over various targets in the Sierra Nevadas, Santa Barbara Channel, and LA basin as part of the NASA Student Airborne Research Program

properties.name: Tim Oakes
properties.description: While there is a great deal of media attention on China's massive investments in rapid infrastructure development, Tim is studying how this development shapes urbanization in unexpected ways, and how infrastructure is constructed not only through formal planning channels but as a result of chaotic, informal, and unplanned developments beyond government control

properties.name: Barbara Buttenfield
properties.description: Works with the U.S. Geological Survey to design and generate multi-scale databases of surface hydrography for topographic mapping and environmental modeling. She also works on digital terrain analysis, reducing errors in numerical analyses by improving measurements of distance, surface area and volume for natural hazards modeling.

properties.name: Tasha Snow
properties.description: Uses satellite remote sensing to investigate how the oceans interact with Greenland outlet glaciers and may contribute to observed patterns of ice change over the past two decades.

properties.name: Theodore Barnhart
properties.description: Providence Creek (CA), the Jemez River (NM), and Como Creek (CO) are part of Theodore Barnhart's dissertation work investigating how changes in snowmelt influence streamflow production across the western United States

properties.name: Theodore Barnhart
properties.description: Providence Creek (CA), the Jemez River (NM), and Como Creek (CO) are part of Theodore Barnhart's dissertation work investigating how changes in snowmelt influence streamflow production across the western United States

properties.name: Sarah Crepinsek
properties.description: studying the variability of ground heat flux at the Tiksi Arctic Station. My research will show why scientists can't assume a single ground heat flux value for one Arctic station as in past/current models, and that ground heat flux should be measured in all major soil types at an Arctic station to produce a "weighted average" ground heat flux value

properties.name: Sarah Crepinsek
properties.description: Visited the Arctic station of Alert this past October to install, re-calibrate, and maintain solar radiation instrumentation. I am currently investigating how best to mitigate ice/snow/rime collection on the domes of these instruments so that they can more accurately measure solar radiation in the Arctic

properties.name: Glenn Grant
properties.description: Land surface temperature extremes of Antarctica

properties.name: Alice Hill
properties.description: Studies hydrologic controls of the Rio Mara Goldmannon, headwater stem of the Amazon River amidst major hydropower development on this currently free flowing river

properties.name: Mike MacFerrin
properties.description: Studying the influence of meltwater in Greenland's high interior ice, and the way its affecting density, stratigraphy, porosity and runoff of the Greenland ice sheet in a warming climate. I run eight stations on the ice sheet that monitor these processes that we revisit annually on extended field traverses, drilling cores and maintaining the measurements.
